text: English grammar lesson 12 conditionals
as you should know from my earlier
lessons are statements with two parts
there's a condition and there's a result
the condition is usually expressed with
the word if in reported speech
conditional statements need special
attention they'll be the focus of this
lesson in this lesson we'll answer one
main question how do we report
conditional statements let's first
remember what conditional statements are
here are three examples if you had told
me sooner about your birthday we could
have had a party if you want we'll go
out to dinner if I were a better cook
I'd make dinner for you myself
all three statements have two parts a
condition and a result the condition is
expressed by if most conditionals are
expressed this way now the question is
if these are examples of quoted speech
how would you report them well let's
look at them one at a time
example one Shawn says if you had told
me sooner about your birthday we could
have had a party how will you report
Shawn's words will you change his verbs
no past perfect doesn't change in
reported speech and perfect modal's also
don't change so the reported statement
is Shawn said if I had told him sooner
about my birthday we could have had a
party the verbs don't change example -
Shawn says if you want we'll go out to
dinner will you change the verbs when
you report his words yes as you'll
recall from previous lessons
simple present changes - simple past
will
just to would the reported statement is
Shaun said if I wanted we would go out
to dinner is there a pattern meaning is
there some kind of rule yes there is
verb tenses don't change in unreal or
unlikely conditional statements verb
tenses change in real or likely
conditional statements let's look back
at our first two examples example 1
Shaun said if I had told him sooner
about my birthday we could have had a
party here the verb tenses did not
change because we were dealing with an
unreal condition in the past if I had
told him sooner example - Shaun said if
I wanted we would go out to dinner here
the verb tenses did change we changed
them because we were dealing with the
real or likely condition if I want now
let's look at example 3
Shaun says if I were a better cook I'd
make dinner for you myself will we
change the verb tenses when we report
his words no there are no changes to
unreal verbs we have an unreal condition
if he were a better cook
so the reported statement is Shaun said
if he were a better cook he would make
dinner for me himself it's time now for
our first exercise on reporting
conditional statements let's see how
well you understand when we need to make
changes to the verbs exercise 1 read the
quoted speech decide if it is necessary
to change the verb tenses in reported
speech let's start with an example
Miriam says if we didn't have birthdays
we'd lose the chance to celebrate our
friendships if you report
Miriam's words will there be any changes
to the verb tenses
no this is an unreal conditional
statement so the verb tenses do not
change the reported statement is Miriam
said that if we didn't have birthdays
we'd lose the chance to celebrate our
friendships number one Saul says if I
can save enough money I'm going to buy a
plane ticket home and celebrate my
birthday with my family in reported
speech will there be any changes to the
verb tenses yes because Saul used a real
or likely conditional the reported
statement is Saul said that if he could
save enough money he was going to buy a
plane ticket home and celebrate his
birthday with his family
now try number two Travis says if I give
my girlfriend these roses and tell her
I'm sorry she might forgive me for
forgetting her birthday in reported
speech will the verb tenses change yes
with the exception of might might
doesn't change so the reported statement
is Travis said if he gave his girlfriend
those roses and told her he was sorry
she might forgive him for forgetting her
birthday
number three Anya says if I could have
one wish for my birthday I'd wish for a
trip around the world with a few close
friends in reported speech will the verb
tenses change
no because Anya used an unreal
conditional the reported statement is
Anya said that if she could have one
wish for her birthday
she'd or she would wish for a trip
around the world with a few close
friends you're ready for the next
exercise it's time for you to decide
when and how to make changes in the
reported state exercise 2 we're heading
back to the bakery listen to the people
speak report each statement make all

example listen to Al the Baker
if you refrigerate a cake you can keep
it one week what did he say here are his
words is it possible to change the verb
tenses yes it's not necessary if this is
immediate reporting or a general truth
but for this exercise will make the
possible changes owl said that if you

for one week

you might want to

assuming this is not immediate reporting
in much time has passed the verb tenses

Alicia looked at the small cake until

more than eight people number to listen

if you want we can write something on
the king what did she say

three

if I had had more time I would have

here are my words remember I'd like you
